Sequence Information.Peptide Name: NRWC (natural AMPs; bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; Derivative)

Literature Information.Literature: Named by APD as no name given in the paper. The peptide-producing strain inhibited H. parasuis growth. Synthetic AMP inhibited H. parasuis at 10 ug/ml (MIC). Kinetics: The growth of H. parasuis was inhibited by the peptide at 20 ug/ml after 20 min.Antimicrobial robustness: The purified substance was resistant up to 80 Â°C and pH ranging 3-7, but lost activity when treated with proteases pronase E and proteinase K at 10mg/ml. Updated 3/2022
Literature Information.Author: Teixeira ML, Dalla Rosa A, Brandelli A.2013
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of an antimicrobial peptide produced by Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizezinii showing inhibitory activity on Haemophilus parasuis
